results.title: A Perfect world
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Mark Johnson and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Eight year old Phillip, the son of a devout Jehovah’s witness mother, is staying home while all other children are out trick-or-treating. The next morning their home is broken into by prison escapee Butch Haynes, who needing a hostage to aid his escape from jail, grabs Phillip and flees. Phillip curiously looks up to Butch and willingly accompanies him as they take to Texas highway on the run from the cops. Butch is not particularly anxious to make it to the Texas border, being more concerned about fulfilling Phillip’s prohibited wants and dreams. Texas Ranger Red Garnett is not in any hurry to catch Butch either. As Butch and Phillip form a father-son relationship, the paths of Butch and Garnett gradually come together in time for a final confrontation. Cast includes Kevin Costner, Clint Eastwood, Laura Dern and T.J. Lowther.

results.title: A Pathological anxiety
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: A presentation of psychoneurotic conditions. Examines the effect of mental disorder on behaviour, using as an illustration the case history of an office worker whose efforts to suppress his hostility result in a sense of terror and panic which prevents him from leading a normal life. Filmed at Montreal General Hospital with Dr A. H. Marcus and Dr Nathan B. Epstein.

results.title: A Place to begin: St Andrews by the Northern Sea
results.creator_credit: Mark Littlewood, Films of Scotland and Pelicula
results.brief_description: St. Andrews, once the ecclesiastical capital of the country, has the oldest university in Scotland, and is the headquarters of the Royal & Ancient Golf Club. The film shows the town, past and present.

results.title: A Pace ahead
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Australian Dairy Board
results.brief_description: Research is the basis for new and improved products from the dairy industry. Experimental farms test new breeds of cattle, pastures and fodder harvesting and conservation. Shows milk production, butter making, cheese making, and the by-products of casein and malt, and considers the nearby eastern countries as a tremendous market.

results.title: A Place of compromise
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A general introduction to the Australian seashore and its creatures. The place of compromise, is, in fact, that narrow skirt on every coastline where the lives of sea creatures are spent partly above and partly below the water line. The film uses normal and micro photography.

results.title: A One two many world
results.creator_credit: Richard Swinden, Peter Harcourt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film of cinematic metaphor, made by students of Queen’s University. The world of this film, one in which a growing boy finds himself, is a world of imposed conditions and contradictions. Here children turn adult by putting on the appropriate uniforms - the policeman’s, the soldier’s. Many of the sequences are surrealistic in effect, creating a social commentary expressed in symbolic language.

results.title: A One and a two = Yi yi
results.creator_credit: Edward Yang, Naokto Tsukeda, Shinya Kawai, Pony Canyon, Omega Project and Atom Films
results.brief_description: A ruminative work of great beauty, contemplation and poignancy, “Yi-yi” is a film about three generations of a Taiwanese family, grappling with the notions of regret and acceptance of life’s turbulence. Director Edward Yang (highly regarded for his sprawling masterpiece “Brighter, sunny day”) shows great understanding of the human condition giving his protagonists space for introspection as they reflect over their fate. Winner of Best Director at Cannes 2000, this is an intelligent, detailed piece, which accumulates to create a complex tapestry — about alienation in modern life, dysfunctional families and the desire for happiness. Cast includes: Wu Nien-Jen, Kelly Lee, Elaine Jin, Chen Xisheng, and Jonathan Chang.

results.title: A Nous la Liberte = Freedom for Us
results.brief_description:
Two convicts, Louis and Emile, escape from prison, but Emile is recaptured. Louis makes his way into the world and advances from gramophone salesman to owner of a huge, modern gramophone factory. When Emile is released, he joins is old cellmate at the plant. After things go wrong, they take to the road together as tramps. Clair has created a sublime musical comedy satire on the work ethics and the dehumanizing effects of mass-production techniques. The film inspired Chaplin’s ‘Modern times’, in which there are similar sequences on the assembly line. Danger in ‘A nous la liberte’ often comes in the form of prophetic images of militaristic domination: the factory guards wear proto-fascist armbands and uniforms. The film equates authoritarianism with capitalist exploitation of the working class. Emile’s one time fellow prisoner, Louis becomes a wealthy industrialist and builds a factory modelled on the prison from which he once escaped. But Emile is the Dada remedy to Louis’s capitalist order. Everywhere he goes, straight lines collapse in confusion and mass production comes to a standstill.” Reference: Alan Williams. ‘Republic of images: a history of French filmmaking’. Harvard University Press, 1992.

Credits: Producer, Frank Clifford ; director, Rene Clair ; writer, Rene Clair ; photography, Georges Perinal ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Lazare Meerson.
Cast: Raymond Cordy, Henri Marchand, Rolla France, Paul Olivier, Jacques Shelly, Andre Michaud.

results.title: A Place in the sun
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Musser, University of California, Los Angeles and Junior League of San Francisco
results.brief_description: This film reveals the work being accomplished by doctors and specialists working in schools especially for the treatment of cerebral palsy. Children are seen being helpted to improve their muscular co-ordination and learning to do things for themselves such as putting on shoes, doing up buttons, and handling a knife and fork. Shows through patient handling by their instructors, the children are enabled to return to their own homes where the treatment is carried on by their parents under supervision.

results.title: A Place in the country: Renfrewshire Regional Park
results.creator_credit: David Lewis, Films of Scotland and Tree Films
results.brief_description: Describes the first country park to be established in Scotland. Different groups of people are seen visiting the park: a family picnic party, a young couple going for a walk, two hikers and a party of school children. A regatta at Castle Semple Loch is shown. The film shows the range of attractions the park holds for all.
